recommendations: Agam Goyal ‚ÄúAditi is a smart, passionate and highly aspiring person. She has a very high sense of ownership. She has been instrumental to grow Kaarva tremendously and in her journey with us, she wore multiple hats at different point in times. She has keen acumen for learning new things quickly. She is very observant which makes her a great product researcher, strategist and execution specialist. I have had the privilege to work with her in all her different stints in ops, product, growth and sales. I wish her all the best in all her endeavours always. Keep rocking and always growing !‚Äù

Shubham Jain ‚ÄúI worked with Aditi on a short term behavioral science research project. One of the most driven, passionate and smart person I have met, she is an absolute pleasure to work with. She is full of new ideas and her inputs have been very valuable to our study. A cheerful and fun person to be around, I am certain she will add a lot of value to any organization she joins. ‚Äù

publications: [{"title":"Piloting a methodology for sustainability education: project examples and exploratory action research highlights. ","subtitle":"Emerging Science Journal","date":"Oct 2019"},{"title":"An Analysis of Critical Success Factors of Implementation of Green Supply Chain Management in Indian Tube Manufacturing Industries","subtitle":"Springer","date":"September 12, 2019","description":"Synopsis:Green Supply Chain Management (GSCM) has emerged as an organizational philosophy to strive for sustainability excellence through the integration of ecological concepts with Traditional Supply Chain Management (TSCM) principles. Due to increasing environmental, economic and regulatory issues there is an urgent need to implement GSCM but Indian tube manufacturing SMEs are struggling to do it. This paper aims to identify various critical success factors to implement GSCM in Indian tube manufacturing SMEs by consultation with the industry experts and academicians. Interpretive Structural Modeling (ISM) technique is adopted to propose a structural model that not only helps us to understand the interrelationships between the different CSFs but also explains their interdependence in implementing GSCM. MICMAC analysis is performed to determine the driving and dependence power of the CSFs and classify them according to their significance. This approach is applied to 10 tube-manufacturing industries in the western region of India.About Book:This book focuses on novel design and systems engineering approaches, including theories and best practices, for promoting a better integration of people and engineering systems. It covers a range of hot topics related to: development of human-centered systems; interface design and human-computer interaction; usability and user experience; emergent properties of human behavior; innovative materials in manufacturing, bio-mechanics, and sports medicine, safety engineering and systems complexity business analytics, design and technology and many more."}]
projects: [{"title":"Smart Dustbin","start_date":"Nov 2017","end_date":"May 2018","description":"Dustbin which displays the quantity of food dumped, every time an individual throws leftover food in it and generates an alarm if the wastage is beyond a certain value."},{"title":"Shape of Me","start_date":"Jun 2017","end_date":"Jul 2017","description":"Put together an online resource community to bring hope and help to those struggling or fighting with body shaming."}]
